title: Data Scientist
description:
**Role:**

  

* Carry out end-to-end development and delivery of AI solutions including data pre-processing, data analysis, model building, fine tuning, deployment in cloud environments and maintenance.
* Design, construct, install, test, and maintain data management systems to meet business requirements and industry practices.
* Develop and implement scripts for database maintenance, deployment, and ETL operations.
* Manage cloud services, particularly AWS and Azure, and other cloud storage systems relevant for the development of data and AI solutions.
* Monitor data performance and modify infrastructure as needed to improve existing pipelines and models.
* Collaborate with data architects, cloud architects, software developers and other IT specialists on project goals.
* Assist in developing and documenting feature lists, user stories, and roadmaps aligned with the overarching product vision.
* Collect and synthesize product feedback from stakeholders through data analysis, surveys, concept testing, analytics tools, and A/B testing.
* Communicate complex concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
* Stay updated with the latest technology trends related to data science, data engineering and AI.
* Be involved in execution of academic and research projects relevant from the overall Enterprise AI organization perspective.
* Support ideation process during various internal and external ideation sessions with own technical and entrepreneurial approach and experience.
* Proactively identify business opportunities through technology driven innovation.
* Participate in knowledge sharing activities to elevate company on AI related topics.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* 5-8 years of experience in end-to-end development and delivery of data and AI solutions.
* Familiarity with Databricks and experience with repository management tools like Git.
* Over 5 years of experience with cloud services: primarily AWS and / or Azure.
* Strong knowledge of Python, SQL, and experience in Java or Scala.
* Experience with big data technologies such as Spark.
* Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised machine learning tools and methods as well as with mathematical programming techniques (e.g. mixed integer linear programming).
* Bachelor’s / Master’s / Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Software Developer, or similar role.
* Experience leading and collaborating on cross-functional projects to build products and address concerns in a collaborative and timely fashion.
* Certifications in AI technologies would be an advantage.
* Experience in end-to-end development and delivery of software products in cloud environments is mandatory.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Period**: 01-10-2024-30-06-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 30-09-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: ML Engineer to Tobii MLX Team
description:
In Tobii we believe that machine learning (ML) first solutions is the future and we have already started our transition journey. For us to succeed we need to design and build up a robust ML Platform and we are currently looking for a person already working in Tobii for this role! Is this the new you?
  
Now imagine a team that not only masters the art of machine learning but also transcends geographical boundaries to deliver unparalleled innovation. We are that team. Our ML Excellence Team is a collective of top-tier professionals from around the Tobii sites, united by a passion for technology and excellence.
  
Our ambition
  
**Diverse Expertise:** Our team’s global footprint brings together a rich tapestry of skills and insights, enabling us to tackle complex problems with creativity and precision.
  
**Technological Prowess:** We are not just users of the latest technologies; we are pioneers, constantly exploring new frontiers in machine learning to keep our product teams ahead of the curve.
  
**Commitment to Best Practices:** We don’t just follow industry standards—we set them. Our commitment to best practices ensures that we deliver only the highest quality solutions.
  
**Scalable Impact:** Our ML platform is robust and adaptable, designed to cater to the evolving needs of products and projects of all sizes.
  
Responsibilities
  
Build robust and high performing ML platform that will enable Tobii to take on any ML/AI related challenges.
  
Be a promoter of best ML practices and stay with latest industry trends.
  
Be part of defining ML strategy and evolve Tobii to be a more mature engineering organization with ML focus
  
  

Other responsibilities include
  
Creating, optimizing, maintaining, and deprecating the components of the infrastructure that supports model development, productionisation & deployment.
  
Ensuring adoption and enablement of the tools and processes that are meant to facilitate the data science teams’ work, including unblocking projects as needed or offering support in areas where tooling and automation haven’t been created yet.
  
  

Skills we think will help you to be successful in this role
  
3+ years’ Experience in Python
  
General understanding of ML Workflows and what steps are needed to build a model
  
General understanding/interest in cloud computing
  
Confident with writing code in a team and bringing software to production
  
Able to work independently
  
  

Nice to have
  
Experience in Distributer, Kubernetes, ETL, or Data Lake is meritable.
  
Familiar with Infrastructure as Code concepts
  
Higher education in mathematics, computer science, physics, statistics, or related fields (not required but surely a plus)

title: Graduates 2025 - Data, AI & Machine Learning
description:
**Intro**

Are you a curious and ambitious AI/ML/data enthusiast ready to dive headfirst into data and client projects on an exciting adventure after graduation? Then join us at Curamando and turn your passion into impactful, groundbreaking solutions!


Curamando is a fast-growing consultancy offering services in areas such as top-line revenue growth, digital strategy and analysis, working with clients like Polestar, Samsung and Alleima. We are part of the Nordic consulting house, Eidra, with our main office on the newly refurbished block Grev Tureplan 1 in central Stockholm. In total, we are over 1200 employees, located in nine offices from Stockholm to New York.


**About the Graduate position**

We are looking for students graduating in the Summer of 2025 to join our Insights & Analytics team in August. Our team consists of experts within both AI/ML/data science and data engineering/data architecture, so you will get to decide which area you want to specialize in or if you want to gain experiences in both, aligned with your personal goals and preferences. Coming directly from university, you would be joining us as an Analyst, our entry level position. As an Analyst, you will be working alongside senior colleagues and helping with implementing our digital solutions for clients. We believe that learning and doing are important parts of your early career, which is why we immediately want you to get your hands dirty (with code) and get to try out the skills you’ve developed during your education. General responsibilities include:


* Partaking in client conversations and projects
* Delivering data science and/or data engineering solutions, for example:
	+ ML/AI based models, ranging from random forest classifications to LLM:s
	+ Automating workflows
	+ Building data pipelines to integrate data across the business and deliver insights
* Designing and implementing modern cloud-based data platforms
* Collaborating with other Curamando teams and companies within Eidra
* Representing the company in outreach events, for instance case studies for students or AI lectures for clients
* Researching and implementing the latest technologies in our field, such as OpenAI’s and Google’s AI models


As an Graduate, you will also have the opportunity to participate in our Analyst Program along with fellow graduates from different domains, packed with exciting events and courses!


**The Analyst Program**

The Analyst program includes a set of courses, designed to ensure sure that you, during your first year at Curamando, develop the crucial skills to be a professional data consultant. It also includes social activities and meeting and visiting colleagues from our different companies and offices around the world.


**Who we are looking for**

To be a good fit for this role, we believe that you


* will be graduating in the Summer of 2025 with a master’s degree in data science, machine learning, AI, computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, industrial engineering or similar
* have skills in Python, SQL, or similar languages
* have skills in, or a strong interest in learning about, data related methods and solutions for company growth
* are a curious, collaborative team player, eager to grow and learn
* have great communication skills, both written and verbal, in English
* are based in Stockholm, or able to move here

**Our recruitment process and how to apply**  

  

The first step of our recruitment process involves an online test that assess your personality traits. If meeting our initial criteria, you will be invited to participate in an Assessment Day at our Stockholm office, where you can expect a company introduction, an interview and you will present a homebased case that you have prepared in advance. After the assessment days, we will carefully evaluate your performance and overall fit with our organization, and make a final decision regarding your suitability for the position.


To apply, please click “Apply for this job” and follow the instructions. Apply the latest on 20th of October.


We’re looking forward to hearing from you!


**About Curamando**

At Curamando, we work in diverse cross-functional teams of business consultants, data and AI/ML experts, project managers, and more. We celebrate autonomy, initiative, and responsibility, while always maintaining a secure support network of fellow colleagues. With tasks ranging from cutting-edge AI implementations to complex and sustainable data architectures, no two days are the same. As a recent graduate, you'll find yourself in an environment that's perfect for learning and development. Rather than being a small cog in the machine, you'll feel the direct impact of your contributions. Because at Curamando, your ideas and efforts aren't just valued – they're essential to our collective success and your professional growth.

title: Experienced leaders to grow our AI & Data team in Deloitte
description:
We support organizations in their challenges regarding strategy issues and in the implementation of complex transformations that often include major business-driven IT changes.


At Deloitte, we truly believe in the acceleration of the value of data. Our AI & Data team is now looking for additional data analytics consultant. You’ll be part of a team at the forefront of analytics that works with capturing data’s value and helping clients to understand the way into the future.


**Senior FSI leader(s) to our AI & Data team in Stockholm (Sweden)**

Deloitte’s AI & Data team is growing and seek senior leaders passionate about AI/GenAI, data and cloud technology, with experiences and a network in the Financial services industry that want to help grow our practice. We see a strong demand for Deloitte and our service offerings and need more senior capacity to help serve our clients. As a leader in our AI & Data team you will be part of an industry team as well as one or several key account teams. The Deloitte culture is highly collaborative and the industry team and account teams will support you with their network, as well as having expectations that the AI & Data team bring forward relevant market offerings to the industry and target accounts. Your role will, together with other leaders in AI & Data, help to drive these market offerings forward to the market, serve our clients in projects as well as helping managing and grow our junior colleagues. Depending on interest we also offer you to help drive one or several of our strategic eco-systems and alliance partnerships.


**Key responsibilities**

* Maintain and build new business relationships with key clients
* Build, drive and manage a pipeline of opportunities
* Drive relevant proposals and RFP/RFIs
* Work with business development-oriented activities
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, as well as engagement manager for project deliveries
* Manage and coach colleagues in our team
* Help with recruiting new talents
**Qualifications**
------------------

The requirement for this role is:


* Consulting experiences in the field of AI, BI/analytics and/or data advisory services
* You live and work in Sweden, preferably in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Relevant university education, most likely a masters degree
* A minimum of 8+ years of relevant work experience

It is beneficial if you have experience with any of the following:


* Financial services industry experiences, but other industry experiences are also of interest
* Experiences with Databricks, Snowflake and/or any hyperscaler (GCP, Azure or AWS)
**Additional Information**
--------------------------

**We offer**

We can offer you access to our global AI & Data network of experts, a stimulating and supportive environment and a fantastic opportunity to help you take the next step in your professional career. You will also be part of a steep Nordic growth journey which in the future will open up for many new career opportunities within our Nordic firm.
  

  

**The way of working at Deloitte – our commitment to you**

At Deloitte we **foster a collaborative culture** where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights, and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.
  

  

Our role is to **unlock potential for growth and innovation** . We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals, and ambitions.
  

  

We **work together with our clients** to help find the right solution and to help to apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we have started.


**How to apply**

You apply online. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we are screening applications continuously and interviewing on a rolling basis. Please submit your CV, cover letter and university grades as part of your application.
  

  

As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
  

  

**Questions?**

If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Patric Barenthin pbarenthin@deloitte.se . For questions regarding the role or application process, please contact Johannes Forgaard, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at jeikforgaard@deloitte.se .


**We are looking forward to your application!**

**What impact will you make?**

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.


**Job Location**
----------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Juniora Analysts till Operations, Engineering, AI & Data (Stockholm) - Jan 2025
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
-----------------------

Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Operations, Engineering, AI & Data stödjer våra klienter i att driva strategiska förändringsprojekt där vi implementerar affärsstrategier och utvecklar deras operationella förmågor för att hjälpa dem nå sina affärsmål. Vi arbetar med verksamhetsförändring där vi använder våra industrispecifika lösningar och tekniska kunskap för att transformera, modernisera och optimera våra klienters processer och tekniska plattformar.


**AI & Data:**

AI & Data-teamet hjälper våra kunder att förbättra beslutsfattande genom datadrivna insikter och skapa insiktsdrivna organisationer med hjälp av AI, analytics och data. Teamet arbetar med teknisk implementering av lösningar inom AI, GenAI, cloud data platforms, data warehouse, BI/analytics samt datakataloger och hantering av masterdata, men också med rådgivning inom dessa områden. Detta innefattar data och AI strategi samt -governance. Vår modell är on-the-job-training där du växer in i mer ansvarsfulla roller, men du kommer också att vidareutbilda dig i olika tekniska plattformar, t.ex. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure, Snowflake och/eller Databricks. AI & Data-teamet verkar i en nordisk organisation med mycket kunskapskapital och kompetens så du kommer också att medverka i projekt, communities och utbildningar tillsammans med dina nordiska kollegor.


**Operations, Industry & Domain Solutions:**

Vi hjälper våra kunder att på ett innovativt sätt förändra sina organisationer. Detta kan innebära att driva större och mindre förändringsprojekt, förnya sin operativa modell, implementera nya system och processer eller förbättra sin effektivitet. Vårt team fokuserar primärt på bank- och försäkring där vi arbetar tillsammans med flertalet av Nordens största banker och försäkringsbolag, samt hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn.


Vi arbetar ofta ihop i projektteam med en stark laganda, där du som Analyst spelar en viktig roll och arbetar nära kunden. Som Analyst kommer du att driva analysarbete, stötta i framtagandet av presentationsmaterial och tillsammans med ditt team hjälpa kunden att lyckas med sin förändringsresa. Du får möjlighet att arbeta nära och lära dig av våra erfarna kollegor om olika industrier och hur man arbetar med affärsutveckling, och inte minst hjälpa våra kunder att adressera spännande tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar.


**Kravspecifikation**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad ingenjör eller ekonom med en masterexamen inom management, data/data science/analytics eller finans. För att trivas bra i rollen bör du även vara utåtriktad och initiativrik samt drivs av nya utmaningar.


Vidare ser vi gärna att du innehar:


* Goda studieresultat, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher

Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.


**Ytterligare information**
---------------------------

**Vi erbjuder**

Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i ett team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och som är i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär samt kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.


**Ansökan**

Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:


* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.

Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval.


Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/ . För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.


**Frågor**

Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Maria Brengdahl Bengtsson, mbrengdahlbengtsson@deloitte.se .


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**What impact will you make?**

På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.


**Arbetsplats**
---------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Artworker
description:
**Diversity matters**
We are building a brand that represents the people of the world. It’s what you do that counts, and we are always looking to expand perspectives and voices to shape our future.

We see you, we celebrate you, we want you!  

  

**Who we are**  

You might know Lush as the inventors of the bath bomb, but we have way more than pioneering cosmetics to offer. We want to show that companies can be a force for good that can be used to give back to the world. We want to fight cruelty like animal testing, support regeneration and show that insides do count - whether it is ingredients in a lotion or the minerals in a smartphone.

People are at the core of our company. We want you to thrive and challenge yourself, build a career and to learn from each other. We have therefore created a work culture where your job description is a starting point, not an end goal. Our work flow is flexible, flowing, supportive and authentic. Permanent employees get, among other things, 50% staff discount, birthdays off and are a part of our Employee Benefit Trust.



Joining the support team for Lush Sweden means you will join a small local team where departments are responsible for their own tasks but also collaborate and help each other run the 7 local shops and local website, as well as acting support team for Lush Norway where we currently have 1 shop. You will also work together with the global artwork team, with colleagues from all over the world.  

  

**Please Note: All applications must be submitted in English. Applications submitted in other languages will not be considered.**

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Localisation and creation of artwork assets such as labels, signage and flyers using a range of Adobe Creative Cloud software.
* Ensuring artwork is consistent, accurate and in line with Lush brand guidelines.
* Setting up artwork for print processes.
* Carrying out proof checks prior to print.
* Order handling and contact with external printers.
* Localisation of ingredient lists based on the EU standard with the help of translation tools.
* Managing files in different systems.
* Helping out with copywriter tasks when necessary.

  


**Knowledge and capabilities or skills:**


* Relevant education in communication/content creation/graphic design or equivalent work experience - preferably university studies or higher vocational education.
* Adobe Creative Cloud Suite, mainly InDesign and Illustrator.
* Highly organised and able to manage different types of content and files in a deliberate and methodical manner.
* Flexible and able to respond to changing priorities.
* Self motivated with drive to complete tasks with little supervision.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to work against set deadlines.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, not only for the work but also in liaising with global teams.
* Creative with an eye for composition and design.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Detail-oriented.
* An interest in the cosmetics industry.
  


**Benefits & Perks in Sweden:**


* Lush Sweden is connected to union agreements (kollektivavtal); for shop staff “*Detaljhandelsavtalet*” with Handelsanställdas förbund and for support staff “*Kollektivavtalet för tjänstemän inom detaljhandeln*” with Unionen.
* 25 yearly vacation days
* Bonus programme
* Employee Assistance Programme provided through Health Assured
* Health care allowance (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* Terminal/monitor glasses (if needed)
* Occupational health care
* 50% staff discount
* Birthdays off
  


**Collaboration:**


* Copywriter
* Digital Manager
* Retail Manager
* PR
* Digital Marketing
  


**Job title:** Artworker


**Role type:** 40 hours per week, 1 year contract with possible extension


**Salary band:** SEK 312,000 - SEK 360,000 per year


**Location:** Stockholm hybrid
company_description: You might know Lush as the inventors of the bath bomb, but there’s more to this great-smelling, privately-owned, family-run company than pioneering cosmetics.

title: Customer Analyst - Loyalty
description:
We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Clarion Collection® Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 166 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.
We are now looking for a **Customer Loyalty Analytics** expert to join our team at Strawberry! We are seeking someone who can help us enhance the member experience and strengthen both the transactional and emotional loyalty within our club.



Our goal is to ensure that our members always feel valued, and that our loyalty program continuously evolves to meet their needs. To achieve this, we need you – an analyst with a sharp eye for data, insights, and solutions to take our loyalty program to the next level. If you have experience with loyalty programs, customer journeys, and have worked with analytics that drive business value, we would love to talk to you!


### **What you will be doing:**



In this role, you will play a key role in identifying how we can improve the member experience, journey, and lifecycle. You will be part of a team responsible for understanding our customers and their behaviors, making our products and services more relevant to them every day. By gathering and analyzing relevant data, conducting modeling, presenting insights, and recommending actions, you will help the organization deliver the best customer experience, drive business KPIs, and strengthen both transactional and emotional loyalty.



You will work closely with other analysts and specialists, and interact daily with business experts from Loyalty, CRM, Product, and even Business Finance.  

  

**Your main responsibilities:**


* Analyze internal and external data to provide answers and drive business actions for our members.
* Create what-if scenarios and run experiments to test hypotheses about member behavior and value.
* Analyze partners and evaluate their financial contributions to our organization and loyalty program.
* Build models to segment customers, predict next actions, and support improved personalization for members.
* Ensure delivery of data and insights to guide the development roadmap for the Loyalty program and partner portfolio.
* Promote data awareness within the business and support the organization’s data-driven decision-making goals.
* Establish best practices to increase the business’s appetite for analytics, improve insights adoption, and promote self-service.
* Be the data-driven thought leader for loyalty analytics.

### **Who we think you are:**



You have a deep understanding of loyalty programs and solid knowledge of loyalty data and analytics. You bring relevant experience in handling member data, including loyalty partnerships and financial models related to loyalty economics. As an excellent communicator, you can clearly explain data and insights and thrive in a multilingual environment. You also have experience in Product Analytics and Product Management. Additionally, you possess a commercial mindset and can proactively identify business opportunities that support program goals and KPIs.


**Your skills and qualifications:**


* Around 4-5 years of experience as a Customer/CRM analyst or in similar roles.
* Proven experience in assessing different data sets, gathering data from multiple source systems, and activating it.
* Experience with DW, PBI/Tableau, SQL, BigQuery/Google Cloud, Python, or similar analytics tools.
* Experience using CRM solutions or similar tools.

### **We will offer you:**


* The opportunity to influence the creation of a member journey which impacts end-user value directly
* Exceptional colleagues and an inclusive, experimentation-based, and innovative culture - we love to share and learn from each other, and test ideas if they work
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work - we are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.

### Sounds interesting?



If you're ready to embark on this exciting journey with us, we'd love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!
company_description: We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. Join a world of experiences!

title: Technician/Engineer (Voice & Real-Time Services)
description:
**Start****05-01-2025****Duration****4-6 months**
  
**Emagine are now looking for a Technician/Engineer (Voice & Real-Time Services) to one of our nordic banking clients.**  

  

**Start:** 2025-01-06  

**End:** 2025-06-16  

**Location:** Stockholm (3days on site, 2 days remote)  

  

**Beskrivning:**


We recognize that the world of finance is evolving at an extraordinary speed. That's why we're committed to driving towards a more sustainable future for everyone — people, businesses, and society. Since we welcomed our first customer in 1856, we have been a catalyst for positive change by providing reliable advice and capital to people with ideas for the future. If you are ready to make your mark on our industry and positively shape the world, you will thrive.  

  

**Project and role description:**  

We are Looking for a highly skilled Technician/ Engineer to join clients Voice & Real-Time Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for operations, project work, and the maintenance of critical Contact Center and Recording solutions.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Support operational tasks within Voice & Real-Time Services.
* Maintain large installation of interaction recording system
* Perform administrative tasks within communication systems, handling incidents, and troubleshooting.

  

**Required Qualifications**:  

* 5+ years of experience in a technical engineering role, with a strong focus on interaction recording systems.
* Experience working with Mitel and Recording solutions.
* Hands-on experience with telephony/contact center systems.
* Proficient in Jira and Agile workflows.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.

  

**Personality Traits:**  

* Driven and self-motivated.
* You enjoy engaging with your colleagues, contributing to a positive work atmosphere, and are easy-going and adaptable with strong teamwork skills.

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience with large tech projects.
* Experience with Saas/ cloud applications

  
Endi Dedic
Business Manager

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.


Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.

 **Job Description**  

The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.

 **Qualifications** **Required:**

* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers

**Nice to Have:**

* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS

  

**Additional Information**  

* Remote work option
* Employment contract
* Stable employment with an attractive salary
* Unlimited paid holidays
* Various benefits including private medical care, Multisport, and pre-paid cards
* Opportunity to work in an international department and collaborate with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds
* Participation in the development of a leading international software firm
* Freedom and autonomy to succeed, with an unlimited vacation policy that focuses on results


At Unit4, you will join a team of enthusiastic professionals dedicated to personal and professional growth. If you are excited about working in a challenging international environment and making a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply.

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Integration Engineer
description:
**Join Our Team as an Integration Engineer and Shape the Future of Digitalization**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Are you interested in driving innovation and transformation with the power of MuleSoft™ and Capgemini? We've been proud partners of MuleSoft since 2008, and our close collaboration has led to many successful projects, particularly in the banking industry.**  

  

**Together, MuleSoft and Capgemini provide a versatile integration platform that can handle on-premises, cloud-based, and hybrid deployments, using open-source API connectivity. This platform allows businesses to connect their applications, data, and devices easily and cost-effectively. If you're ready to take part in this exciting partnership, we welcome you to join us"**

**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

**We're looking for an experienced developer or architect with a minimum of four years of experience in MuleSoft or integration, and ideally some experience with Dell Boomi or Java. If this sounds like you, we'd love for you to join our team! We value fearlessness, proactivity, and a willingness to continuously improve, and we're excited to work alongside colleagues who share these traits. Our dynamic and evolving environment allows you to collaborate with individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures. You have a passion for exploring different techniques and aren't afraid to seek assistance when needed. You're eager to grow your skills and contribute to our growth in the MuleSoft domain.**  

  

**We believe in providing our team members with the best possible opportunities to succeed. That's why we offer customized skills development, free certifications, and the chance to work on exciting customer assignments in some of Sweden's largest companies. As an integration specialist, you'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies such as EDT, ETL, API, MuleSoft, Kafka, and Big Data. You'll be involved in every step of the delivery process for system integration, from start to finish.**

**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

* **Proven experience in integration development and/or cloud integrations**
* **Comfortable in agile teams and contemporary development settings**
* **Higher education degree or equivalent**
* **Proficient in customer communications, both verbal and written, in Swedish and English**
* **Prior experience with Mulesoft, Apigee, Boomi is beneficial**
**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**
-----------------------------------------------------

* **We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**
* **At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**
* **Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies**
**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Machine Learning Engineer to Interspectral, a 3D visualization pioneer
description:
Are you an experienced engineer, eager to develop AI software solutions to enable Industry 4.0? As a Machine Learning Engineer at Interspectral, a pioneer in advanced 3D visualizations and data analysis within additive manufacturing, you will develop and optimize AI models to help our innovative software transform complex data into actionable insights for our customers. If you're ready to make an impact in the world of digital twins and additive manufacturing, we’d love to meet you!
  
  

ABOUT INTERSPECTRAL
  
Interspectral is a forward-thinking company specializing in advanced 3D visualizations and data analysis/artificial intelligence and multi-channel digital twins for Industry 4.0. We develop cutting-edge visualization software to convert complex data into actionable insights. We have been international since start and our vision and goal is to bring clarity into Industry 4.0 with Multi-channel Digital Twins. Our product AM Explorer is a visualization software package that makes it possible to fuse, explore and analyze simulation, monitoring and post build part analysis data from the metal additive manufacturing process.
  
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
  
We are looking for a talented and ambitious Machine Learning Engineer with a focus on developing and integrating AI solutions in our software AM Explorer. Together with colleagues in our development team, you will be responsible for developing, deploying, and optimizing machine learning models in real world production environments to solve our customers’ specific needs. Whilst the focus in the role is on practical, hands-on development of our product, we are also continuously exploring and researching how to improve our software to keep adding value to our customers.
  
  

**Some of your responsibilities include:**  

* Develop and deploy AI models with a focus on computer vision
* Ensure models are effectively implemented in production environments
* Collaborate with our development team to optimize models and improve customer solutions


Depending on your experience, skills and interests, the role can include other tasks as well. In this role, you will be mainly working closely together with our AI-researchers, as well as our whole Development team consisting of brilliant programmers and application engineers. You report directly to our CEO Isabelle.
  
  

This is a full-time role based in our headquarters in the heart of Norrköping where we have team members working with sales, marketing and software development.
  
  

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
  
To excel and thrive in this role, you should have a university degree in a relevant engineering field and at least 3 years of experience working with AI solutions in production environments. You bring hands-on experience with multi-sensor input, multi-modal models, and the integration of AI into native applications. Proficiency in MLOps and model optimization workflows is essential, along with expertise in standard ML tools and frameworks such as Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar. We also assume that you have familiarity with a cloud platform. A PhD in a related field and experience in statistical modeling, data analysis, and algorithm development within established product development processes are a plus. While C++ skills are not mandatory, they are a welcome bonus.
  
  

Moreover, we believe that you are a practical, hands-on and solutions-oriented person who enjoys working in a cross-functional team. You enjoy using your experience and skills to take initiative and come with suggestions to improve the product offer and ways of working. Whilst you enjoy working in a team, you have a proven ability to work independently and take responsibility for driving projects from development to deployment in a structured way.
  
  

Since we work on a global scale, you need to be comfortable and fluent in written and spoken English. You should also have a valid work permit in Sweden to start the position as soon as possible.
  
  

Do you feel like you do not tick all the boxes above? Apply anyway, and we will assess whether you could be a fit at Interspectral, either now or in the future!
  
  

WHAT WE OFFER
  
As a growing company, we provide excellent opportunities for career development. We encourage and support your ambition to strengthen your professional skills. Additionally, we offer a flexible and dynamic work environment that fosters continuous development, and we also offer a secure employment with wellness benefits, insurances and pension plans. Finally, we really like to have fun together, whether it's during a company curling session, horseback riding adventures or our Friday lunches.
  
  

WE WELCOME DIVERSITY!
  
At Interspectral, we embrace diversity and welcome qualified applicants regardless of gender, age, disability, ethnicity, or sexual orientation. Join us in shaping the future of Industry 4.0 and become part of a team dedicated to creating innovative solutions and driving continuous growth and development.
  
  

Application procedure
  
We are going through applications regularly, so please apply today if you are interested.
  
  

As part of our comprehensive recruitment process, we use both personality and logic assessments to better understand your unique strengths and abilities. These assessments help us ensure a well-rounded evaluation. We value your privacy, and the results of these tests will be handled with the utmost confidentiality.
  
  

Do you have questions about this role? Please contact our HR-partner Emma (emma.bjurling@interspectral.com) who will happily assist.

title: Line Manager CUCP Services UE & Cell CP2
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

EU Cloud RAN is the organization within Ericsson that develops and release our Cloud based RAN solutions. We’re delivering live systems for general use as well as trials to explore and help transform the telecom business into a cloud-based operations model. We’re also evolving our system architecture and ways of working to match this transformation.  

Our current solutions are built around the virtual node concept with a vCU, two different vDU:s and AppSS built on the ADP platform. The vCU currently consists of both the Control plane (CU-CP) and the User plane (CU-UP) but it is our ambition to transform our system architecture, modularizing the system to identify smaller, individual services/applications that can have separate LCM.  

In this journey, the Cell handling, Ue handling, Configuration handling, Network interfaces handling, and the Packet processing, are components that we aim to separate out.  

General characteristics and release handling are done on the vCU CSAR (delivery package), though, including the AppSS services. In the CU-CP, most of our code is shared with MS-RBS within the RC function. This sharing is based on Inner Source principles and co-ownership

 **What you will do:**

  

* As unit manager of the CP2 unit, PEU vCU CU-CP Services in EU Cloud RAN, it is your responsibility to act as owner for the Traffic Control SW UE- and Cell Domains and microservices.
* You will lead two development teams, one of them being the TC SW UE domain responsible team, and the other being the TC SW Cell domain responsible team.
* You will also have the domain architects for Cloud RAN deployment in the unit to be able to investigate and define the architectural journey and anchor those in the CU- and RCF Techno.
* You will also be responsible for SW quality, general performance and handling of technical debt in your unit. Cloud related aspects as resilience, scalability, LCM (e.g. InService SW Upgrade) as well as footprint will be important. You will report to the head of vCU CU-CP Services and be part of the unit’s leadership team.
* You are a structured person with experience from product development in general. You are familiar with the different tasks involved in product development and value the developer experience (DX) for your teams.
* SW craftmanship and design ownership comes easy, and you recognize the needed steps and measures to uphold good SW quality and product integrity.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Proven leadership with a track record of enabling change Passion for identifying new ways of working (continuous improvements).
* Understanding of customers and competitor situations.
* At least 5 years work experience in telecommunication and/or cloud.
* In the PEU vCU organization, we believe strongly in equal opportunities and the values and focus areas of Ericsson. You are expected to lead by example. Integrity is especially important in this role.
**We are looking for the following characteristics in our future leadership team**

  



Respect - evident in all dealings within and outside the team Professionalism - always keep our customers in mind Facts based reasoning - ready to take decisions, facts based and courageously Speedy execution - acting promptly when action is called for Empathy & Humanness - always see the human behind the task. You will operate across PEU and EU borders.

 **Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**

**What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. title: Senior Sales Executive
description:
Join Nordcloud and make your mark on the European IT industry. Help our clients thrive on their cloud journey in solution areas such as infrastructure, migration, data, and security.


**Currently, we are looking for a Senior Sales Executive to join our team in Sweden.**


**Your** **daily responsibilities:**

  

* As Sales Leader, winning new logos for Nordcloud Sweden in Enterprise and Corporate business segment
* Achieving sales targets in consultancy & service sales from target clients in scope
* Developing sales strategy in the allocated territory
* Being a trusted advisor to the customer by developing a deep understanding of target customers' business
* Developing and building relationships with C-level and senior executives at current and potential clients, both in strategic and tactical level in governance
* Implementing a solution-based approach while managing and understanding complex customer needs through the sales process
* Ensuring that current and new clients implement strategies that maximize Nordcloud's value proposition, including infrastructure, application, managed services and consulting portfolio
* Working closely with our partners at Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud
* Providing timely and insightful market feedback to other functional teams including product management and marketing
* Presenting Nordcloud at events and in the media by attending trade shows and special events
* Occasional travelling in Sweden or Europe may be an option, depending on the assignment and your preferences


**Your key skills:**


* 7+ years of sales experience within the area of IT Consulting / Technology
* Proven track record in leading, winning and developing new logos in IT Consultancy and Service business
* You already have a developed stakeholder network in the industry with clients as well as partner echo system
* Proven ability to Solution Sell, empathize and develop customized value propositions for clients and prospects
* Experience in driving sales within enterprise and mid sized corporations
* Experience from adopting a Challenger sales methodology in all client interactions
* Experience from working directly with C-level stakeholders and senior IT executives
* Experience with enterprise RFP processes
* Drive, passion, and team spirit
* Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills
* Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, high growth and rapidly changing environment
* Bachelor Degree or equivalent preferred (Business, Engineering, Computer Sciences)
* Customer-first attitude and experience in serving large-scale customers
* Fluent communication skills in **Swedish** and **English**


**Skills we'd consider a plus:**


* Experience in Cloud Services technical offering, processes, and tools
* Public cloud experience (AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud)


We encourage you to **apply**, even if you don't meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!

  

**What we offer:**

  

* Individua**l training budget** and **exam fees** for certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment of your choice
* **Local package** such as six weeks of vacation, a pension package, private health care through EuroAccident, wellness benefits (Friskvårdsbidrag), and you can also pick more benefits from benify.se
* We are part of the collective bargaining agreement (Almegas Kollektivavtal - Tech Sverige)


Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://nordcloud.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/) before applying. **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**


**About Nordcloud**


Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. We are triple-certified across Microsoft Azure (https://nordcloud.com/multi-cloud/microsoft-azure/), Google Cloud (https://nordcloud.com/multi-cloud/google-cloud/) and Amazon Web Services (https://nordcloud.com/multi-cloud/amazon-web-services/), and we are recognized as a 'Visionary' by Gartner for Public Cloud IT Services. With 10 European hubs and over 1200 employees, we are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and we have delivered over 1000 successful cloud projects (https://nordcloud.com/case-studies/).


Learn more at nordcloud.com (https://nordcloud.com/) and follow the #NordcloudCommunity (https://www.instagram.com/nordcloudcommunity/).

  

*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*

title: Data Center Technician
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
* Experience with performing component-level repairs on IT equipment
* Experience diagnosing and troubleshooting one of the following: operating systems and computer/server hardware or networking protocols
* Ability to travel up to 20% of the time internationally
* Ability to lift/move 50lb (23kg) of equipment and ability to exert yourself physically over extended periods of time, including frequent bending, kneeling, climbing, pushing/pulling and lifting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Completion of the online Google IT Support Professional Certificate program
* 2 years of experience diagnosing and troubleshooting one of the following: operating systems and computer/server hardware or networking protocols
* Experience working within a data center or network operation center environment
* Ability to collaborate and partner with teams to overcome challenges
* Ability to adapt to changes in a dynamic work environment


**About the job** 
 Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Deploy and operate new data center infrastructure across projects or functions.
* Report issues and follow data center procedures to troubleshoot and diagnose straightforward issues with equipment or infrastructure as they arise, and applying the resources needed to resolve identified issues.
* Maintain the security and integrity of data, track various forms of media to check for standard data security issues (e.g., data was not properly erased) handled in accordance with Google security standards.
* Disassemble specific equipment that has reached its end-of-life via part replacement or maintenance, in a team setting.
* Repair, fix, and perform preventative maintenance on equipment, servers, machines, or infrastructure based on identified issues with defined solutions and limited guidance.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
* Remote work option
* Employment contract
* Stable employment with an attractive salary
* Unlimited paid holidays
* Various benefits including private medical care, Multisport, and pre-paid cards
* Opportunity to work in an international department and collaborate with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds
* Participation in the development of a leading international software firm
* Freedom and autonomy to succeed, with an unlimited vacation policy that focuses on results


 At Unit4, you will join a team of enthusiastic professionals dedicated to personal and professional growth. If you are excited about working in a challenging international environment and making a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Junior Salesforce Specialist
description:
Vizrt Group, the industry leader in broadcasting graphics, with a global presence and offices in over 30 countries, is currently undergoing an exciting phase of growth and digitalization. Our cutting-edge solutions empower media organizations to captivate audiences with visually stunning and engaging content. As we focus on enhancing our business processes and systems to support our expanding operations, we are seeking a talented Salesforce professional to join our team as a Salesforce Specialist.
 


****About the role{{:}}****
* Serve as a key member of our strong internal Salesforce team, driving the business transition to Salesforce as our strategic platform
* Troubleshoot technical issues related to Salesforce implementation and integration, ensuring smooth operation and user satisfaction for our go-to-market solutions
* Work closely with other parts of IT such as ERP and integration to support a seamless business experience, fostering collaboration and efficiency across the organization
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to customize and enhance Salesforce components such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, Account Engagement, and Customer and Partner Portals, contributing directly to the success of our go-to-market strategies
  

  


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, demonstrating a solid foundation for success in driving our go-to-market offerings
* Certification in Salesforce is required, while experience and/or certifications in Platform Developer/App Builder and CPQ are highly valuable.
* 1-2 years of hands-on experience in Salesforce, showcasing your expertise in leveraging Salesforce to drive business outcomes
* Experience working as a Salesforce consultant is highly valued, highlighting your ability to provide strategic guidance and deliver impactful solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues
* Effective communication and collaboration skills to work closely with business stakeholders
* Strong documentation skills and proficient in English
* Project management experience with the ability to lead initiatives from conception to implementation is a merit
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to be a part of our strong internal Salesforce team, shaping the future of our offerings and driving innovation in the industry
* Work in a collaborative and dynamic environment with a focus on innovation and continuous improvement, where your ideas are valued, and your contributions make a real difference
* Stay at the forefront of technology and contribute to our organization's growth, with opportunities for professional development and advancement
* Vizrt Group is a truly global company, providing the opportunity to collaborate with stakeholders around the world and make a global impact
* Exciting position in an open and friendly environment that fosters mutual development and value creation, where you can thrive personally and professionally
* Opportunity to grow and learn from knowledgeable colleagues through learning paths, with access to ongoing training and development opportunities
* Emphasis on work-life balance and diversity in the workplace, ensuring a supportive and inclusive environment where everyone can thrive
* Comprehensive rewards package, including flexible working hours, competitive remuneration, health care insurance, wellness allowance, and more, recognizing and rewarding your contributions



  
 



 Salesforce is our strategic platform and is crucial for our go-to-market offering, supporting partners, customers, and customer success organization. If you are passionate about leveraging Salesforce technology to drive success in our go-to-market strategies and shape the future of our offerings, we invite you to join our team as our Salesforce Specialist. Your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our digital future and driving our continued success in go-to-market strategies. Joining Vizrt Group offers a fantastic opportunity to be part of a highly innovative and dynamic organization, where you can make a meaningful impact and grow both personally and professionally in the realm of go-to-market strategies.
 



 Additional Information{{:}}
 



 The Stockholm office is home to a diverse team of approximately 70 employees representing over 20 different nationalities. We have recently moved to a brand new office located in Lilla Bantorget, near Stockholm Central Station, providing a convenient and modern workspace for our team. At Vizrt Group, we believe that everyone has a unique story to tell. We'd love to hear yours.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Role:**
* Carry out end-to-end development and delivery of AI solutions including data pre-processing, data analysis, model building, fine tuning, deployment in cloud environments and maintenance.
* Design, construct, install, test, and maintain data management systems to meet business requirements and industry practices.

* Communicate complex concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.

* Support ideation process during various internal and external ideation sessions with own technical and entrepreneurial approach and experience.

* Strong knowledge of Python, SQL, and experience in Java or Scala.

title: Customer Success Manager

**No telco experience? No problem!**

**What You’ll Need**
* Project or delivery management experience, ideally within tech or SaaS.
* Strong communication skills, with a talent for building lasting relationships with international partners and clients.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on achieving results.

 We offer a competitive salary based on experience, along with the flexibility to work remotely and opportunities for continuous learning and career growth.
   

  

 If you're passionate about transforming the mobile communication industry and eager to join an innovative, fast-growing company, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today to join
 **Telgea.com** 
 and help us build the future of global mobile plans!

title: EMEA North Head of Enterprise Greenfield
description:
**Description**
 As the Greenfield Leader for Europe North you will work closely across Sales, Marketing, Inside Sales Centre, Partner, Professional Services, Training & Certification and Enterprise Support teams to deliver a high-quality customer experience and support our customers in their journey to the cloud. We work backwards from our customers, focusing on their use cases and defining how our broad set of technology solutions can help them. Planning for market adoption, setting vision and strategy for your team, and pivoting on emerging market trends are all things you will do on a daily basis. The right candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions while working cross-organizationally to build consensus.
   

  

 This role will report directly to the Europe North Leader, leading the Europe North Greenfield Sales team. This leader will bring deep and strong C-level relationships and experience (in business and IT / CIO functions across enterprise levels) to help further establish AWS as the leader in enterprise cloud computing. We are looking for a self-starter who is prepared to own, define, develop and execute the Enterprise Greenfield strategy in line with AWS strategic direction and Europe North initiatives including defining market segment strategy, ensuring effective engagement with Enterprise Greenfield customers (by engaging CXO and SVP level business and technical executives), and achieving scale through partner, marketing and the Inside Sales Centre function. They should also have strong business acumen and the executive presence, since much of the work we do with the team is to ensure the executives at our customers are bought into the idea that AWS can be a strategic partner to help them achieve their business objectives.
   

  

 In this role, your responsibilities will include hiring, developing and managing a highly talented sales team focused on driving new customer acquisition, platform adoption and revenue growth. The ideal candidate will possess a tenured sales management background enabling them to lead a team of senior enterprise sales managers and representatives with engagements at the CxO level, manage a sales pipeline, and lead sales efforts that will include teaming with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Cloud Sales Centre, Marketing and Partner teams (among others). The ideal candidate should possess strong communication skills such as discovery/active listening skills and empathy, as well as demonstrated ability to provide constructive mentoring in these areas.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Develop the short, medium, and long-term Europe North Enterprise Greenfield strategy including critical scaling mechanisms like marketing, sales plays and campaigns, executive engagement, skills and enablement.
* Define a comprehensive Enterprise Greenfield partner strategy to scale and grow Enterprise Greenfield through the partner ecosystem including global and national system integrators, consulting and technology partners.
* Manage sales cadence through robust performance measures and reviews, using data driven analytics, to drive strong sales execution. This includes owning all metrics and goals and reporting of all account related activity i.e. sales forecasting, account strategy, demand generation, deal strategy development and trend analysis.
* Lead establishing and nurturing external communities, and driving large events. Defining which of these we do (CIO Forums, CXO Advisory Groups, etc.), and working with local and regional leaders to implement globally.
* Hire, develop and retain a strong team of sales professionals who are responsible for building net new business in Europe North.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Various years of technology related sales or business development experience.
* Strong Sales management experience leading teams selling enterprise solutions for software, hardware or IT
* Strong experience developing CEO level relationships across large enterprises and demonstrated ‘door opening’ capability
* Experience as a Leader of Leaders with team focus of development of large strategic accounts
* BA/BS degree required.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
* Commercial and contract negotiation experience
* Ability “to sell business value” using ROI and TCO models, rather than competing on “features & functions”


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2751447

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer

We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**

Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently work towards identifying the candidates that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.

Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new ideas and perspectives to Sinch!e

title: Account Manager to ABAX Sweden
description:
Are you passionate about cultivating customer relationships and driving additional sales? Does the prospect of working with cutting-edge technology services captivate you? If so, keep reading for an exciting journey ahead!
   

  

 ABAX is on the lookout for a dynamic and driven Account Manager to join our Swedish team based in Stockholm! Are you ready to embark on a journey with us? Join the adventure at ABAX!
   

  

 In this role, you will work with your customer portfolios to ensure that customers derive the most value from our products and services. Your key responsibility will be to provide expert guidance on additional product sales and inclusive services. Through relationship-building and a deep understanding of ABAX's services, you will empower customers to enhance efficiency, save money, and gain control over their own cars, tools, and machines.
   

  

****Some of the things you will be working on:****
